title: A Talk With Shachar Kariv On Behavioral Economics
author: Seeking Alpha
dc:creator: Seeking Alpha
description: Shachar Kariv, a decision theorist at U.C. Berkeley and chairman of its economics department, has the unique distinction of relating behavioral economics in a fashion that is relevant to investment decision makers. In other words, it’s not just academic. In this podcast, he answers such questions as what are the key trade-offs we should consider in making investments; what kind of investor should go to a financial advisor; and who is more important – your advisor or your physician?
